intro: Hieronyma asperifolia, commonly known as the rough-leaved hibiscus, is a species of flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its rough, hairy leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in humid, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, contributing to its propagation in the wild.
